duties_responsibilities.duty: Inspire and lead the teaching staff in effective classroom management practices and motivate students to achieve academic and personal excellence.
Facilitate and develop professional development workshops to drive the school’s cultural framework and analyze student behavioral data.
Enforce the school's culture and climate vision, develop interventions for students, and promote attitudes, behaviors, and skills for improved learning.
Support teachers in leading classrooms with high-quality student learning and engagement, predictably respond to student behavior, and build meaningful relationships with students and families.
Work collaboratively with the counseling team, advisors, and Principal to plan individual school and system-wide programs to promote a positive school culture for students and teachers.
Develop and execute the school’s character development program, facilitate staff training, and monitor school-wide behavior and discipline data.
Maintain accurate behavior data, develop and revise the student handbook, and disseminate information about school disciplinary policies and procedures to the learning community.

education_certification.credential: Master's degree in Education, Counseling, or related field (Ed.D. preferred)
